reviews.review_msg: This prof is the most disrespectful, unhelpful, and ignorant person I have encountered in college, met with her 4 times to discuss a group project and asked for more guidance, she was so rude and made me feel so dumb. She threatened to take my group to the dean... She is so disrespectful and does not know how to teach. Avoid her at all costs.

This professor was not understanding at all, I was not given credit for an assignment simply because one of the attachments would not open for her. Everything was completed and handed in on time but I was given a 0. Very hard exams, and when students ask questions in her class her way of responding to them is not encouraging nor pleasant.

I talked to her about my grades and how she is a hard marker and i was talking very nicely she said that she will help me and see what she can do, next day i received a letter from the Dean to meet immediately because she reported me being RUDE!!. Thanks God that i have worked with the Dean and she knows me personally! Otherwise i would be in troub
Rude Rude RUUUDE!! always make things so hard and never easy on the students!!

Worst professor I ever had, Rude and arrogant and hardest marker i ever had. Her exams doesn't reflect any of her power point or the textbook. PLEASE do your self a favour and safe your GPA. Mine dropped so badly after taking her class.

You wanna hurt your GPA? take a class with her. She destroyed my high GPA with her very strict grading. She gave us an essay of 4-6 pages that was due in three weeks. The essays are super time consuming, I worked so hard on my essay i went to the learning centre and they checked it. she was very strict and she gave me an average mark for it!!
she would give assignments which would be due the next day

Colleen is a great choice as a professor. She gives great and interesting lectures which keeps you engaged throughout the whole class. You definitely have to read the textbook and make sure you're taking notes always in order to do well. She cares about her students if you show you care about her class.

Collin has definantly been one of my favourite professors, if you try and read the lectures you will do good in the exams.. shes a very fair marker and if she sees you put in effort and know the material she will bump your grade up.

Stay very far away from her. From day one she was arrogant and demeaning. Reads lecture notes then gets confused when she loses her play. Not open to differing opinions!!! Her way or the highway. Openly hostile when being asked questions. Confused students further when asked for clarity. Stick to working in prison and forget "teaching".

I'm not going to jump on the band-wagon here. Colleen can teach a class. She is warm, humorous and can engage a classroom. She really cares about education and adapts character to her class. Academic honesty and hard work is the only way to success, so suck it up and read. Colleen makes a fun class and provides content you'll never forget.

Worst professor I ever had, she managed to destroy my high GPA with her unreasonably strict grading. Rude and arrogant and the hardest marker, doesn't really give A's. If you're taking a course with her, save your GPA, and drop it now! No matter how hard you work on the unreasonably high work load, you will have extreme difficulty getting an A.
Just an awful professor. What is she even doing here?

One of the best classes I have taken in my undergrad. Colleen gives very clear instructions in what she expects, and provides detailed feedback in papers. She is very passionate in her work and in RJ. Lectures and tutorials were great.

I would take again. There is a weekly essay, but they are short (2-3 pages) and you hand them all in at the end of the month. If you follow the guidelines exactly you will get an A. Do not try to argue against her in papers. She is very warm and helpful if you see her one on one. Tutorials are so fun!
The course is really interesting and the topics are good, but the essays were a bit time consuming.

She's very knowledgable on restorative justice and the critical analysis papers every week are short and easy to write. She gives you the expectations and all you have to do is answer the questions and incorporate lectures, tutorials, and experiences. Must show up for tutorials but they are fun and not your usual tutorials. Would take again.
I loved the class and was really interested in RJ, however Colleen sucked as a prof. If it was not for the people in the class I would've never shown up. Do yourself a favour and do not take her!!!

This class requires a lot of work. Expect 2-3 hours of readings per week and a 3 page essay each week. Definitely not an easy class but tutorials are fun. Basically get 22% of your grade from showing up to tutorials and participating in games.

Had horrible lecture notes. You definitely have to buy the textbook because studying off of the lecture slides will not be enough for the exams. The online portion of the class was stupid and time wasting because it wasn't even exam-able.
This lady does not know how to teach! If you're interested in learning about RJ take the courses with someone else.

Probably the worst class I have ever taken during my time at sfu. Her expectations for the essay are unreasonable. The essays are super time consuming. I thought I was going to enjoy this class but I absolutely hated it.

I really enjoyed Colleen's class. My only complaint is that she was a little disorganized at times. She is very nice and is there to help you if you need it. It is important that you do the readings in the textbook as well as follow along in lecture, as material from both will show up on the exam. With a little effort you can do well in her class.

Colleen is an awful prof. Her lectures are long and boring, she's frequently disorganised, and she's very opinionated. Her criteria for tests and papers is often either false or misleading, the tests do not reflect the work material. She is also not welcoming to questions. I would advise everyone to stay away from her class if at all possible.

Probably the worst prof I've ever had. She's disorganized, doesn't know the answer to any questions asked, does not review any material, her tests do not reflect any of the material in the textbook or her pathetic notes.  PLEASE avoid her. Do yourself and you GPA a favour and avoid this prof like the plague.

man this class was bad. i'm a first semester transfer and I have to say I expected some more professional teachers than this... it's like she taught two classes.. the online tutorial gives you the meat and potatoes and then colleen just rambles on for hours, the class constantly clowned her... also why did she force us to read her stupid shorthand?

I understand others' comments but think it comes down to lack of clarity. Packs so much additional info into lectures, there's not enough time to ask questions to clarify so busy taking notes.  Felt sorry for those wo laptop. End up with so many notes you have to decide btwn textlec notes to study. Midterm based on text, final lec notes.
Tests and assignments are graded at a 400 level. Has no knowledge of course content, reads lectures entirely off scripts, unable to answer questions.

By far the worst prof I've ever had for any course. Thank god I took this class in my second year because I would be beyond confused. How can she put so little effort into this class and expect the class to do well? The course material itself is easy but I would not recommend taking any classes with her!

Colleen should not be teaching Criminology, she will make you second guess your choice of major. Her lectures are boring and pedantic. During one class she explained that she was a hard marker because "I need to get hired again next term". I seriously regret taking this class with her.

Don't take her for CRIM 104!!  She marked the exams at a level WAY above first-year.  Her expectations on the (mostly written) exams are not only incredibly high, but also incredibly confusing.  You will have to be an absolute master memorizer to be able to get an A on the midterm and final.  It's ridiculously infuriating what she expects of us.
I don't recommend anybody to take RJ class with her. She is v v v hard marker.

Make sure that you spend lots of time on journal. Otherwise get ready to cry with your grades:( She does not provide enough feedback. The class is boring because she is heavily dependent on power-pints and scripts.
Very hard marker and rude.
Not recommended
CRIM-315 is a great course but never take this class with her. You will get completely wrong impression about RJ from her class.

Colleen is great! Engaged with the material and prioritizes student learning. Yes, she is "hard marker," as other students note, but this is a third year class and a certain level of knowledge is required to pass. Helpful feedback and good dialog. One of my favourite classes at SFU.
She doesn't have lectures. Heavily based on textbook and she is a SUPER hard marker. Would not recommend to anyone. Rather you take it with another prof

Do not take this as a gpa booster. She is a very good prof and cares about her students. However, she is one of the hardest markers. She goes over your paper with a fine tooth comb and her exams pull heavily from the textbook and requires a lot of detail. The course itself had a lot of guest speakers and a prison tour which was very beneficial.

The class presentations seem intimidating at first, but you will learn a lot out it. Exams are drawn heavily from both the texts and lectures. She is not an easy prof, but if you go to her office hour, she is very willing to help. Guest speakers and prison tours are the most interesting aspect of her class, so don't skip.
Not helpful, not the most informed on her own topics.  Pulls heavily from text for her exams and is a hard marker.  Boring lectures and dreadful student presentations.
The instructor is really harming the  development of RJ. Her teaching style does not at all represent any RJ values. She thinks that she is 100% right and she is arrogant in expressing her opinion.

RJ is an important rethink to how criminal justice services are delivered in North America. However, Colleen presents a deeply one-sided and narrow view to RJ which intimidates students from voicing dissenting opinions. This causes tremendous animosity because she marks all the assignments which are worth 70% and so you can't risk offending her.

Up for a challenge? Love being active and tested to your limits? want the ride of your life? love the feel of exhaustion? well we're not talking about joining the police force, but this prof will give you all that! enlist today.

You will have to read all the material in order to write good journals. Be aware that she is very biased towards RJ so criticizing RJ will lose you marks. Even if you don't agree, just go with it if you want a good grade. She may seem a little abrasive but it's better to speak to her privately. The majority of the DVD videos are on Youtube!!
Very unhelpful and opinionated which is completely what she teaches in RJ classes.

Colleen's firm take with all her students and her marking is quite opposite to the nature of RJ, in my opinion. Making this course as difficult as it is (deliberately adds extra reading material weekly in contrast to prev profs) is making the students hate the class.  If you truly care about RJ you should take this into consideration

Ironically, shes very uncompromising and demonstrates no care for students by rejecting all extreme circumstances (even if w/written proof) for missing tutorials.  Reads directly off notes in class. No improvemt since last sem's comments by students. Seems to thrive on marking hard & making things hard b/c she keeps smiling abt it.

Extremely unhelpful professor. She was very unclear about her instructions and seems to constantly contradict herself. Very hard marker but her comments on papers/journals are both misleading, unhelpful, and unreasonable. I would avoid her at all costs.

Nice lady, but not a good instructor. Her presentations are very dry, and she is a very hard marker as said before. Also she treats journal entries like term papers--you need to answer number of specific questions and have a intro/conclusion. That's quite a lot to cover in few pages don't you think? I would avoid this course if she is teaching it.
I noticed some of the comments were deleted. Anyways please don't take this personally, take its as a constructive criticism.

She is passionate but she tends to be defensive and oppressive to views that are against hers. She recognizes most students take 315 under the impression it will be a cake walk So she is very specific in her marking and tends to be extra critical. Guest speakers played an important role to her course because her lectures were difficult to endure.
Hard marker. Can get very defensive. Gives confusing instructions and often contradicts herself.
Hard marker and very defensive. Anyways its RJ so her classes will always be full. But just be careful. Its not a GPA booster class.

I suffered from a very boring lecture where she just reads from her notes! the only saving grace was her awesome guest speakers. Anyway the environment she created tends to force people to agree with her RJ principles Always needing people to say RJ works and stuff So people with opposite views are scared to voice otherwise. only as a last resort
Overall good teacher. You can tell she's really passionate about the material. Encourages interaction and participation, but is a hard marker!
